alert.note: Alert for Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:23PM EDT until May 14 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following county, Owen. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain fell due to thunderstorms. Flooding is likely ongoing in the warned area. Between 3.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Owenton, Monterey, Gratz, Elmer Davis Lake, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Long Ridge, Harmony, Squiresville and New Liberty.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
